Header: Deadline for chainsaw registration extended till March 15th
Content: The Defence Ministry has said that the deadline for the registration of chainsaws which was to be concluded yesterday has been extended until March 15th. It said this will not at all be extended. Registration of chainsaws began on February 20th upon the instructions of President Maithripala Sirisena in a bid to control deforestation. The registration process was due to end yesterday. All state, semi-government, private-sector institution or privately owned Chainsaw Machines should be produced at the nearest police station and a registration permit obtained before March 15â€³ the Ministry announced. A special license and a number will also be issued for identification purposes following the registration.
